event: Earliest human presence in present-day Suriname
Indigenous Arawak and Carib societies establish river settlements
Indigenous trade networks link the Guianas and Amazon region
European explorers reach the Suriname coast
English establish early plantations along coastal rivers
Dutch gain control of Suriname from the English
Plantation economy expands using enslaved African labor
Treaties recognize Maroon communities formed by escaped slaves
Slavery is abolished under Dutch rule
Indentured labor immigration begins from Asia
Suriname gains internal self-government within the Dutch Kingdom
Military coup brings prolonged political instability
